reviewText:
This a pretty simple and short game.

The objective in adventure mode is to eat all the Blobbidees while trying to run away from Queen Blobbidee. You can have a friend join you for Local Co-op adventure mode.

In battle mode the objective is to gain the highest points by chomping another chompy. This is really good if you have friends playing with you so that all four of you can compete with each other.

It took me four hours to get all the achievements and had fun doing so. If you are looking for a simple local Co-op game try and have a look at this game.
voteText: 27 of 27 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: The first things I noticed before playing were how bright and vivid the graphics were, and how the characters were crisp and animated nicely. The neon-colored characters on a white menu took me aback at first but I quickly adjusted. While short, the action was fast and busy. The targets changed every so often which kept everyone on their toes. My few complaints would have to deal with the level design. Each screen has a different look and feel to them, but some just don’t seem a good fit. The multiplayer is really competitive and a lot of fun.All in all, Chompy Chomp Chomp was a fun and amusing game. The pace and action kept everything fun but it’s best to bring 3 others friends along if you wish to experience the full potential of this title. A nice buy if you want to have a fun and fast session with friends or family.

reviewText:
Chompy Chomp Chomp is a very simple game. If you want a myriad of playing options and a wealth of choice, this is not the game for you. The single player arcade mode is weak, but is at least expanded with co-op mode.

At it's local multiplayer heart, it's good fun though. It's frantic and a good take on the Bomberman game, while remaining pleasantly simple and looking pretty good. However, it is severely lacking in some areas - there is no online multiplayer which is a big misstep and I would have liked more modes in the game as there's only so much you can do with points and time.

I wish there was a mixed feeling option for this game as there is certainly potential and if you play a lot of local multiplayer you will get a lot out of this as it's a blast. On the other hand, there's so much that could have been done to make the game better rather than a lazy single player mode, and if that's the sort of thing you like about games you're not going to have a good time.

Based on my preferences, this *just* earns a recommendation but wholly conditional on if you like local multiplayer. I hope the devs do a lot more with this title as the potential is there - they just need to capitalise on that.

reviewText: I dunno, I had a blast in Arcade mode. Battle mode is... battle mode is VERY frantic. It's played on very small stages with your characters being fairly large targets. I think that with friends, it would be humorous. But Arcade was worth it to me. I had fun switching colors, getting alternating chains, trying to beat the darn thing twice through... then three times through because hey, why not, it's like beating Dig Dug three times through, you do it just to increase your score, and because the gameplay appeals to you! Chompy Chomp Chomp's gameplay appeals to me. For the most part, it is exactly what it says it is: an arcade game. There's a simple yet challenging gameplay system, fun score multipliers and awesomely useful powerups, and increasing difficulty with harsher time rewards on subsequent playthroughs. It's done very right and I found it to be very fun.

reviewText:
Not enough content to justify a purchase.

The game kind of reminds me of the ghosts from Pacman. Everyone is trying to eat one another, and you have to run from the player trying to eat you while also running after another player you are designated to eat. The more you eat other players the more points you get. That's about it....

There is also a short lived Arcade mode, where you basically go around trying to eat organge, and purpose blobs while avoiding a big black blob. You have a time limit that carries over from every stage so it's basically how far can you get before the time runs out"
date: and the "levels" are basically the same each time.\n\nThe only positive about this game is that it may be a fun "party" game if you have 4 people to play with

reviewText:
A fun little game that can best be described as a multiplayer versus pacman. Mechanics are simple and effective, but given the nature of the game content is limited.

four players chase each other on a map - each player can only eat one coloured player, and can only be eaten by one coloured player. Stay alive and eat your opponents.

There are reasonabley diverse maps and the powerups are quite diverse to.

All in all a simple but reasonably fun game. Price tag is a little steep, but it is worth it on special.

reviewText:
Are you ready for a simple, super fun party game to play with your friends and family? Well if so Chompy Chomp Chomp may be for you!

“Chompy Chomp Chomp is a game where people of all ages, tastes and skills can play together, and enjoy themselves on a level playing field. Play with your friends/kids/boss/gran, lose your inhibitions, shout and scream and generally have an awesome time.”

GameplayRemember in Pacman when you used to run away from the ghosts and when you got fruit you’d chase them back? Well imagine that on a much faster, crazier scale! You play as a little chomp and your goal is to eat everything and anything in the time allowed. You have a glow around the base of your character which indicates who your next target is, watch out though because someone is always after you too!

Top TipThis may seem like common sense but trust me when I say you ever the basics go out the window when playing. So our top tip would be keep an eye on whos after you, and don't get caught in a dead end.

Power-UpsAs with many great games power-ups are involved in the fun, they have various different uses. Some teleport you to a random spot, others make you run fast and some create confusion for other players. We like to aim to get a teleport and when your stuck, out of lucky activate it to keep going.

Graphic StyleWhat’s nice about this if its got a nice, clean style but if the default isn’t enough you can play in multiple styles around many levels.

View Blog Posted - Indie Game of the Week[www.dabs.com]

reviewText:
I hated it. It desperately wants to be a party game, but between the STDs and the bad smack, it just can't muster a good time.

Running face to face with another in a singleplayer game ends with me eaten- always.  I'm not sure if this is a crapshoot or if the game's AI is just favored, but I find the basic gameplay mechanics to be not just simple, but also unforgiving.  It's not fun.  Sounds fun, but not fun.  The suggestion it has that 'Bomberman'-style multiplayer gameplay is an abject lie that flies in the face of all that is good and holy.  I would sell my own kidneys NOT to play this game.  This game is complete horse-♥♥♥♥.

reviewText:
Chompy Chomp Chomp is a small and fun game to play. In Battle mode you simply control two Chompies where you have to eat and avoid getting eaten by other chompies running around various mazes.

In the Arcade Single Player mode, you have to eat as much Blobidee's as you can as the queen Blobidee follows you about.

Other modes have Chompies that are all controlled by other players.

It's just how easy the controls are and how quickly you can just get in to gameplay which is a positive feature right there.

There could be, however, a few more features added to the game like bigger mazes, an increased number of reduced sized chompies on a maze at a time in Battle mode, and improved powerups.

Overall this game is energetic, challenging and fun, giving it 7/10 for now. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who is looking for something that is worth its price. :3

But for rest just buy it when its on sale
You can play with 4 people or just alone vs 3 bots.

reviewText: This games brings both Pac-Man and Bomberman into mind. It allows for 4 players to compete in a devour-a-friend-fest. Also, you can play with bots to fill the empty player slots. Random target swiching leads to hilarious situations that the prey  you chase around the level suddenly becomes the predator hunting you just a second or two before you manage to chomp it up.\nAll in all great fun though a lack of online multiplayer is a bummer.\nC'mon developers, add the online play. The sooner the better.

reviewText: Simple and easy to pick up and play, you'll be chomping your foes in no time if you get this game!  I picked this up on a whim (while it was on sale I think) and was not disappointed.   It isn't exactly a deep game but if you ever enjoyed playing pac-man or mouser back in the old days you might just find this little game to be fun for a while.  It has player vs player and co-op gameplay however it's local only and there's no online play through steam.
